required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Modified Laryngeal Handshake Technique for Locating the Cricothyroid Membrane

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, we compare the conventional laryngeal handshake technique and modified laryngeal handshake technique for locating the cricothyroid membrane in terms of accuracy and speed. The conventional laryngeal handshake technique is performed with the non-dominant hand, identifying the hyoid bone and thyroid laminae, stabilizing the larynx between thumb and middle finger, and moving down the neck to palpate the cricothyroid membrane with the index finger.
The modified laryngeal handshake is performed with the non-dominant hand, stabilizing the trachea between thumb and middle finger from the suprasternal notch and moving up the neck to palate the cricoid cartilage and cricothyroid membrane with the index finger.

primary_outcome.measure: The accuracy to localize the cricothyoid membrane
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after identifying the cricothyroid membrane using the conventional or modified laryngeal handshake technique
primary_outcome.description: The accuracy of the cricothyroid membrane identified by the conventional and modified handshake techniques are evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: The accuracy to localize the midline of the neck
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the identification of cricothyroid membrane, an average of 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The accuracy of the midline of the neck identified by the conventional and modified handshake techniques are evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: The vertical and horizontal distances between the actual and perceived cricothyroid membrane
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the identification of cricothyroid membrane, an average of 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The vertical and horizontal distances between the actual and perceived cricothyroid membrane using the conventional and modified handshake techniques are evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to localize the cricothyroid membrane
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the identification of cricothyroid membrane, an average of 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The time taken to identify the cricothyroid membrane is recorded.

arm_group.description: The conventional laryngeal handshake technique is performed to localize the cricothyroid membrane
The modified laryngeal handshake is performed to localize the cricothyroid membrane

intervention.description: The conventional laryngeal handshake technique is performed with the non-dominant hand, identifying the hyoid bone and thyroid laminae, stabilizing the larynx between thumb and middle finger, and moving down the neck to palpate the cricothyroid membrane with the index finger.

The modified laryngeal handshake is performed with the non-dominant hand, stabilizing the trachea between thumb and middle finger from the suprasternal notch and moving up the neck to palate the cricoid cartilage and cricothyroid membrane with the index finger.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who would be scheduled elective surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diseases or anatomical abnormalities in the neck or larynx
- History of neck surgery
